# Null Sector Shipyards
To assist in developing the Null Sector, shuttles from various organizations were delivered for rented use. All rentals are temporary. Rented shuttles return to the organizations that provided them when it is either time to evacuate, or when shift time is up. The value of shuttles is returned to the purchaser when ended through a ship console. To avoid losses, [bold]make sure you sell your rental before ending a shift[/bold].
## Shipyard Console
To rent a ship: - Eject the ID card from your PDA. - Insert the ID card into an unused [color=#cccc00]shipyard console[/color]. - Use the shipyard console to bring up its interface. - Select the ship you would like to rent. - Press the Purchase button on the console. - Press the Eject button to remove your ID from the console. - Reinsert your ID card into your PDA.
Congratulations, you're now the Captain of your own ship!
To sell your rental: - Make sure your rented ship is docked with Lark Station. - Make sure nobody is aboard the ship. - Eject the ID card [bold]used to purchase the ship[/bold] from your PDA. - Insert the ID card into an unused [color=#cccc00]shipyard console[/color]. - Use the shipyard console to bring up its interface. - Press the Sell button on the console. The value will be deposited into your bank account. - Press the Eject button to remove your ID from the console. - Reinsert your ID card into your PDA.
## Provisions
Ships come equipped with the tools and supplies needed to perform one or more tasks in the Null Sector (e.g. mining, research, medical, food services).
Ships, especially larger ones, work best with a crew. Refer to the [bold]Hiring[/bold] section for more info. Space is a lonely, dangerous place, and you'll have a much better time when you work with a crew.
